chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (12th) and Operating w/ PAC (12th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (12th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (12th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Donnie Gene Richards was found guilty of OWI (12th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.   In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

11:46 pm cases called-14CF134 & 16CF100. Defendant Donnie Gene Richards in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Donnie Gene Richards in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record by Attorney Anderson.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty to Count 1 of 14CF134.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 14CF134 and dismisses and reads-in Count 3 of 14CF134 & 16CF100. No statement by defendant. PSI waived by both counsel. Court sentences the defedant to: 10 years WSP to be served as 6 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 305 days.  CONDITIONS OF ES: Costs plus $3,095.00 plus $42.50 blood draw costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DOC authorization for payment. 36 month DL revocation, 36 mo IID, OWI Assessment. AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court does not find eligible for CIP but eligible for SAP. Appeal Rights Given.
from DA's Office - Extradition Fees $2125.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 11:30 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from leaving the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

14CF134 & 16CF100 Cases called @ 1:07 p.m. Defendant Donnie Gene Richards in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF100 -   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD.  DA Blader requests bond be imposed in the following manner: 16CF100 - $9000 Cash Bond & 14CF134 - $20,000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi takes no position as to bond. Court orders 16CF100 - $10,000 Cash Bond,  14CF134 - $25,000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.

Case Called @ 10:15 AM: Defendant Donnie Gene Richards in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Ryan McElroy sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by ADA.  Record to reflect positive ID of Defendant by witness.  Ex No 1 Marked - Photograph of accident scene.  Ex 1 entered and received.  Cross-Exam by SPD.  Re-Direct by ADA.  Re-Cross by SPD.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by SPD.  Further Argument by ADA.  Further Argument by SPD.  The Court:  Thresholds have been met by the State.  Established clearly and  convincingly that circumstances exist and burdens met - Motion for Suppression is denied.  Warrantless blood draw in compliance with the 4th Amendment. Transport by helicopter would have negated any furhter interraction with arresting officer.  Officer would not be in a position to oversee blood draw.
